business.headline: From AI skilling to real jobs: What industry wants from Budget 2026India has no shortage of AI talent, but turning skills into sustainable jobs remains a challenge. Ahead of Budget 2026, industry leaders want policies that connect training, infrastructure and real-world deployment.
Sensex, Nifty pause winning rally as investors turn cautious ahead of BudgetThe S&P BSE Sensex closed 296.59 points lower at 82,269.78, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 98.25 points to end at 25,320.65.

8th Pay Commission: Will employees get arrears, and if yes, when?With January 2026 nearly over and no formal announcement yet, government employees are growing anxious about the 8th Pay Commission. The big question now is whether delayed salary revisions will lead to arrears, and when the money may actually reach their bank accounts.

Budget 2026: Building India's next-generation supply chainsContinued public investment in infrastructure remains the single most important driver of logistics efficiency. Budget 2026 presents an opportunity to further strengthen this momentum by deepening last-mile connectivity to industrial clusters, agri-production zones, and Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities.

Silver prices slide after hitting record highs. Is it the right time to buy?Silver has finally cooled after a record-breaking rally. With prices stabilising and demand still strong, the real question is simple: will you use this dip to start buying?

Gold, silver ETFs tumble after record highs: Buy the dip or stay cautious?After a strong rally that pushed gold and silver to record levels, ETFs tracking the precious metals saw a steep fall on January 30. The sharp correction has sparked fresh questions about whether the dip is worth buying or if volatility may deepen further.

Budget 2026 should be an exporter's budget. Here's whyFrom tariff pressure to compliance hurdles, exporters are under strain. Budget 2026 needs to focus on easing these burdens so Indian businesses can protect market share and grow confidently this year.

Hindustan Copper, Vedanta, Hindalco fall up to 10%: Why are metal stocks down?The Nifty Metal index slipped close to 5% to 11,855.85, ending its three-day winning run during which it had gained nearly 9%. On Friday, the metal index emerged as the worst-performing sector on Dalal Street.

Budget 2026: What the agriculture sector wants from the governmentIndustry leaders say this budget needs to prioritise technology, climate resilience, credit flow, value-added production and better supply-chain systems to unlock the sector's full potential.
Gold, silver prices fall: Should you buy now or wait?If the sudden drop in gold and silver prices has caught your eye, it's worth knowing what's driving the mood right now.

Budget 2026 jitters on Dalal Street: Why stock market is under pressureMost global markets have been under pressure this week, especially technology-heavy indices, and the impact has spilled over into emerging markets like India.

Budget 2026: What the insurance sector expect from Nirmala SitharamanBudget 2026: A day ahead of the Union Budget, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman tabled the Economic Survey 2025–26 in Parliament, outlining the government's assessment of the economy.

Rupee hits lifetime low of Rs 92 against US dollar: Should you be worried?The rupee's weakness comes at a time when global uncertainty remains high and foreign capital flows into emerging markets have slowed

Sensex falls 500 points: 3 reasons why stock market is falling todayAt around 9:30 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 516.43 points at 82,049.94. The NSE Nifty50 fell 192.75 points to 25,226.15. Market participants appeared to be booking profits and reducing risk as Budget Day approached.

Sensex, Nifty open in red as metal and IT stocks drag indices ahead of BudgetThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 491.22 points to 82,075.15, while the NSE Nifty50 tanked 163.95 points to 25,254.95 as of 9:25 am.

From reforms, jobs to resilience: CEA's key messages before Budget 2026As policymakers finalise the Union Budget 2026, CEA V Anantha Nageswaran has shared key insights on how reforms, employment growth and economic resilience can keep India on a steady path.

Why is the Economic Survey talking about junk food, social media restrictions?An economic survey is mostly about GDP growth and projections. So, why did the Economic Survey 2025-26 talk about rising junk food consumption, obesity and excessive screen time? Citing government data, Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran explained how poor physical and mental health among adolescents and working-age adults could weaken productivity and hurt India's long-term economic prospects.

Many jobs are immune to AI disruptions. Economic Survey lists themEven as Artificial Intelligence reshapes workplaces worldwide, the Economic Survey 2025-26 points to jobs that could be immune to AI disruptions. The survey has identified the kinds of jobs that technology is least likely to replace and explains why soft skills and hands-on expertise matter in an AI-driven economy.

From startups to scale-ups: What women entrepreneurs want from Budget 2026For many women entrepreneurs, the ask from Budget 2026 is clear: help them grow bigger. After years of startup-focused policies, they now want support that enables scale, competitiveness and long-term sustainability.

Sensex, Nifty close higher as Economic Survey lifts market mood ahead of BudgetThe Nifty 50 closed 0.3% higher at 25,418.90, while the BSE Sensex rose 0.27% to end at 82,566.37. Both indices recovered after falling around 0.8% earlier in the day, as buying returned in heavyweight stocks.

entertainment.headline: Send Help review: Rachel McAdams anchors this survival thriller with wit and gritRelease Date:Fri Jan 30, 2026 Send Help is a survival thriller that places Rachel McAdams and Dylan O'Brien in a tense, often darkly funny battle against nature and each other. Directed by Sam Raimi, the film uses survival to explore power, entitlement and quiet personal transformation.

Frieren: Beyond Journey's End Season 2 is a quiet, devastating triumph Frieren: Beyond Journey's End Season 2 deepens its quiet exploration of time, grief and memory with patient, emotionally rich storytelling.

Rani Mukerji hits back at Rahman's remark: Bollywood is the most secular place Oscar-winning composer AR Rahman's comments about alleged communal bias in Bollywood have prompted a public response from Rani Mukerji. She cleared that the industry operates without discrimination and is secular in nature.

Sara Arjun shares her parents' reaction after Dhurandhar, calls it euphoric moment Sara Arjun shared that the release of Dhurandhar became the most emotional moment of her career, as her parents were moved to tears by her performance.

Kim Seon-ho reclaims romance crown with gentle charm in Can This Love Be Translated Kim Seon-ho returns to the spotlight with Can This Love Be Translated? after a temporary break. In this week's K-Fix, we look at how his comeback redefines romance with kindness and emotional depth.

Om Shanti Shanti Shantihi review: Tharun Bhascker film is same-same but differentRelease Date:Fri Jan 30, 2026 The Telugu remake of the Malayalam hit Jaya Jaya Jaya Hey, Om Shanti Shanti Shantihi works in moments but falls short of offering a distinct voice.

Louis Tomlinson Exclusive: How Did I Get Here?, handling pressure, self-love, One Direction, India English singer-songwriter Louis Tomlinson speaks to India Today's Bhavna Agarwal about his musical evolution and his latest album How Did I Get Here?. Reflecting on his journey from One Direction to a confident solo artist, Tomlinson discusses the emotional depth of his new tracks, including 'Sunflowers' and 'Sanity'.

Bridgerton S4 Exclusive: Luke Thompson, Yerin Ha say 'would love to come to India' In an exclusive interaction with India Today's Bhavna Agarwal, the cast of the Netflix hit series Bridgerton, including Luke Thompson, Yerin Ha, Golda Rosheuvel, and Adjoa Andoh, discuss the evolution of love and friendship in the upcoming season 4.
Exclusive: Here's the truth behind Rubina Dilaik's 'I am pregnant' announcement Rubina Dilaik's viral pregnancy announcement had everyone guessing—but the real story is nothing like fans imagined.

Mardaani 3 review: Rani Mukerji stands her ground in a system where life is cheapRelease Date:Fri Jan 30, 2026 Mardaani 3 follows Shivani Shivaji Roy as she confronts not just traffickers, but a system that wakes up only for the powerful. Rani Mukerji takes the legacy ahead in a familiar, flawed, but purposeful film.

Naagin 7's Blood Wedding episode on top, dethrones Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi Naagin 7 has claimed the top spot in Indian television ratings after its blood wedding episode. This dramatic twist challenges long-standing shows and reshapes viewer preferences.

Lady Gaga set to unleash Mayhem live at the 68th Grammy Awards Lady Gaga will join a line-up of international stars for a highly anticipated performance at the 68th Grammy Awards, where she is also in the running for seven awards.

Are film awards fair? Pa Ranjith questions integrity of state, national bodies Director Pa Ranjith has questioned the credibility of government and private award organisations at both the state and national levels, following the announcement of the Tamil Nadu State Film and Television Awards.

The Kerala Story 2 teaser: Ulka Gupta, Aditi Bhatia fight conversion in sequel The teaser of Kerala Story 2- Goes Beyond is out now. The film expands the narrative beyond Kerala and raises the stakes from the 2023 film. Starring Ulka Gupta, Aishwarya Ojha and Aditi Bhatia, it is set to release in theatres on February 27.

Mardaani 3 X review: Fans root for Rani Mukerji, love post-interval drama Rani Mukerji returns as DCP Shivani Shivaji Roy in Mardaani 3, which released today. The film, produced by Yash Raj Films and directed by Abhiraj Minawala, has received strong reactions from viewers on X, who praise Mukerji's commanding presence and the film's continued focus on the issue of child trafficking.

Varanasi plot leaked? Rajamouli film to travel across timelines, continents: Reports Director SS Rajamouli's Varanasi is an epic time-travel adventure spanning continents and eras. The film's release on April 7, 2027, could redefine Indian cinema's scale and storytelling.

Grammy Awards 2026: When and where to watch live in India The 2026 Grammy Awards will feature an extensive list of presenters and performers, with music legends and new talents sharing the stage at Los Angeles' Crypto.com Arena. The ceremony, airing on February 1, promises notable award presentations, tributes to music icons, and live performances from both seasoned and emerging artists.

Alia Bhatt returns to production, announces new film Don't Be Shy Alia Bhatt and sister Shaheen are set to bankroll Prime Video's original film 'Don't Be Shy'. The film is about a 20-year-old girl whose life takes unexpected twists, and everything goes out of control.

Blackpink's Deadline: Concept teaser for first group comeback in 3 years out now Blackpink kicked off their comeback countdown by unveiling the first concept teaser for their third mini album, Deadline. Released by YG Entertainment, the striking black-and-white visuals have heightened anticipation ahead of the album's February 27 launch.

general news.headline: Astounding Alcaraz downs spirited Zverev in marathon, a win away from Career SlamAustralian Open: Carlos Alcaraz has stormed into the men's singles final after beating Alexander Zverev in a semi-final that lasted five hours and 27 minutes at the Rod Laver Arena. In the final, Alcaraz will face the winner of the clash between Jannik Sinner and 24-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic.

64 lakh infiltrators in 7 Assam districts: Amit Shah warns of demographic changesHome Minister Amit Shah claimed that Assam's demography underwent significant change during the Congress's two-decade rule, alleging that seven districts are now "dominated by 64 lakh infiltrators."

NCP leaders meet Devendra Fadnavis, stake claim to Ajit Pawar's portfoliosNCP leaders met Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis to stake claim to the key portfolios held by the late Ajit Pawar, seeking to retain them within the party's quota.

AUS Open Live: Novak Djokovic steaming through 2nd set against Jannik SinnerAustralian Open Live, Men's Singles semi-final: Novak Djokovic is whizzing past Jannik Sinner in the 2nd set. With four games to one, the Serb looks like he has the 2nd set in the bag.

Laid off at 40, boreout at 22: Inside 2026's job crisisAt 40, you're "overqualified," and quietly laid off. At 22, you're "lucky to be here," and slowly bored out. Welcome to 2026's job market: not a crash, but a split reality.

T20 World Cup: Why Pakistan will tuck its tail and travel to Sri LankaPakistan have reportedly threatened to pull out of the T20 World Cup to show solidarity with Bangladesh. But it is highly unlikely that they will ever stick to that. Here's why.

Shashi Tharoor scotches Congress exit talk, praises Rahul Gandhi after meetingA day after meeting Congress's top brass, Shashi Throor reaffirmed his loyalty to the grand old party, saying he will lead the UDF campaign for victory in Kerala Assembly elections.

Miyas will rule the world: How Assam Muslim leaders reacted to Himanta attackA day after Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's remarks on Miya Muslims triggered a storm, Opposition and Muslim leaders of the state slammed him for targeting the poor and branding the entire community illegal. A Congress MLA urged the Miya community to focus on education and vowed that in 15 years, "Miya will not rule just Assam, but the entire world".

When Ajit Pawar's swap deal helped uncle Sharad remain Defence MinisterIn 1991, when PM PV Narasimha Rao named Sharad Pawar the Defence Minister after Congress's election victory, it was Ajit Pawar, a first-time MP, who gave up his Baramati Lok Sabha seat. The move allowed his uncle to contest from Baramati, enter Parliament and continue in the Union Cabinet. But a swap deal was involved too.

The film's unique silent narrative challenges viewers to reflect on morality amid chaos.

Amazon lays off 16,000 employees, hundreds in India impacted: Story in 5 pointsAmazon has announced a fresh wave of layoffs, which is impacting around 16000 employees. In India too hundreds of employees have been impacted in various teams. Here is the full Amazon layoff story summarised with key developments so far.

Lack of menstrual access denies girls their right to education: Supreme CourtThe Supreme Court held that the absence of gender-segregated toilets and access to menstrual hygiene products in schools violates girl students' fundamental rights to education, equality, health, dignity and privacy.

Did NCP merger deal add fuel to BJP-Sena fire?Tensions between the BJP and the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena are becoming harder to ignore amid the tussle over the BMC Mayor's post. This brings up a question. Did the merger talks of the NCP factions headed by Ajit Pawar and Sharad Pawar add to the tensions?

Kuwait-Delhi IndiGo flight diverted to Ahmedabad after bomb threat on tissue paperAn IndiGo flight from Kuwait to Delhi was diverted to Ahmedabad after a handwritten hijack and bomb threat was found on board.

Dhurandhar releases on Netflix but many fans are disappointed. Here's whyAfter creating waves globally, Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' is streaming on OTT. However, fans are quite disappointed after the runtime of the film on Netflix was shorter than the theatre-cut.

Arijit Singh didn't quit playback singing, he walked away from a broken systemArijit Singh's decision to step away from playback singing can be looked at as resistance, not retirement. By rejecting a broken, compliance-driven system, the singer seems to have chosen autonomy over industry approval.

8th Pay Commission: Will employees get arrears, and if yes, when?With January 2026 nearly over and no formal announcement yet, government employees are growing anxious about the 8th Pay Commission. The big question now is whether delayed salary revisions will lead to arrears, and when the money may actually reach their bank accounts.

Hotels in Europe, villas in Dubai: Inside the luxurious empire of Khamenei's sonA year-long Bloomberg investigation revealed that Mojtaba Khamenei, son of Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, is linked through shell companies and associates to a covert, oil-funded global property network spanning London's 'Billionaire's Row,' Europe and the Middle East -- worth over £100 million -- despite US sanctions and public claims of modest living.

India is schooling more children than ever, but learning outcomes keep laggingThe Economic Survey 2025–26 shows near-universal school enrolment in India, but flags that learning outcomes, teacher gaps and post-pandemic recovery remain uneven across states and student groups.

Snow leopard's dramatic prey hunt on Himachal's icy cliffs leaves photographer in aweA rare snow leopard hunt near an icy cliff edge in Himachal left a photographer mesmerised, who shared a video of the encounter on social media.

After Iceland, Uganda ready to replace Pakistan in T20 World CupT20 World Cup: After Iceland, Uganda has continued to troll Pakistan on the uncertainty over the latter's spot in the competition. Uganda have said that they are packed and ready in case Pakistan decide to pull out of the tournament.

Bengaluru techie caught watching Netflix at work, builds AI device to trick bossA Bengaluru techie created an AI-powered device that switched his screen from Netflix to work when his boss approached him, which earned him praise and thumbs-ups online.

sports.headline: India strongest team in T20 World Cup, need luck to beat them: Phil Salt England batter Philip Salt acknowledges India as the strongest team ahead of T20 World Cup 2026. He praised India's dominating run and praised Abhishek Sharma's batting prowess.

In the final, Alcaraz will face the winner of the clash between Jannik Sinner and 24-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic.

Who is Jensi Kanabar? India U14 star scripts history with Australian Open title Jensi Kanabar won the Australian Open Asia-Pacific U14 title after beating Australia's Musemma Cilek 3-6, 6-4, 6-1 in the final. She became the second Indian after Arnav Paparkar to lift the trophy.

Ducks in cricket: There are ten different 'species'. Do you know them all? Abhishek Sharma has now been dismissed for a duck three times in T20Is for India. The sport, however, recognises ten different types of ducks, defined by how and when a batter is dismissed.

Manpreet Singh, 2 others dropped from team due to disciplinary issues: Report Hockey India has excluded veteran Manpreet Singh and two others from the Pro League probables. Sources suggest that this was done due to disciplinary issues during the tour of South Africa.

Virat Kohli's Instagram Account Restored After Overnight Glitch Sparks Panic Among Fans On this Special Report, reporter Sana Farzeem provides details on the restoration of Indian cricketer Virat Kohli's Instagram account. The account, which boasts over 274 million followers, temporarily disappeared overnight, causing a 'complete frenzy and panic' among fans who found the profile unavailable. Farzeem noted that 'it was shocking when we saw last night late at night that his account was disabled' and mentioned that fans even reached out to Anushka Sharma's profile for updates. While the account is now fully restored with all posts and followers intact, the exact cause remains unconfirmed. The programme discusses whether the disappearance was due to a technical glitch, security concerns, or platform guidelines, as no official statement has been released by Meta or Kohli. The report highlights Kohli's massive influence as the most followed Indian on the platform and the relief felt by his global fan base upon the account's return.

India legend PT Usha's husband Srinivasan dies at 67 V Srinivasan, husband of IOA President P T Usha, passed away at 67 after collapsing at home. Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed his condolences, highlighting the loss to the sporting community.

Quinton de Kock smashes all-time record in strong warning before T20 World Cup Quinton de Kock fired a strong warning before the T20 World Cup after he notched a 43-ball century against West Indies, helping South Africa win by seven wickets in Centurion.

Virat Kohli's Instagram Profile Vanishes Overnight Triggering Panic Among Fans This report focuses on the sudden disappearance of Indian cricket star Virat Kohli's Instagram profile, which has left millions of followers concerned. The news presenter notes that a visit to his page currently displays a 'profile isn't available' message, suggesting the link may be broken or the account removed. The speaker highlights the impact of this event, stating, 'this has cricket fans being left scrambling for answers after Virat Kohli seemingly vanished from Instagram overnight.' As the most followed Indian on the platform, the absence of his profile has triggered intense speculation across social media. The report mentions that Kohli has not yet released a statement on any other platform regarding whether this is a technical glitch or a deliberate move. Fans remain on the edge of their seats, closely monitoring the situation for any official updates or the restoration of the account.

AUS Open Live: Djokovic shows signs of a comeback against Sinner in 2nd setAustralian Open Live, Men's Singles semi-final: A positive start for Novak Djokovic, who wins the first two out of three games in the second set. The Serb has to keep the momentum rolling as he dropped the first set of the game.

Virat Kohli back on Instagram, fans breathe easy and Anushka gets a breakIndia cricketer Virat Kohli's Instagram account became active again after disappearing overnight. Kohli's verified Instagram account, followed by over 270 million users, had suddenly disappeared from the platform on January 30.

How India's all-format obsession is quietly undermining its Test futureShubman Gill's chaotic all-format calendar shows how modern scheduling is eroding red-ball skills faster than results can hide them. No wonder India's Test cricket is on the decline.

Djokovic faces Jannik Sinner, a familiar problem in pursuit of 11th titleAustralian Open 2026 semifinal: Legendary Novak Djokovic last beat Jannik Sinner in 2023. He now faces a familiar foe once again in the semi-final clash of the tournament. Will an ageing Djokovic be able to fight off an athlete in his prime?

Did Virat Kohli deactivate Instagram account? Fans seek clarity from Anushka SharmaVirat Kohli's Instagram account disappeared on Friday, triggering speculation online as fans flooded Anushka Sharma's comment sections seeking clarity on the cricketer's sudden absence from the platform.

Grace Harris' all-round brilliance, Nadine's four-fer propel RCB into finalRoyal Challengers Bengaluru reached the WPL 2026 final after an eight-wicket victory over UP Warriorz. Grace Harris and Nadine de Klerk's outstanding performances helped RCB storm into their second WPL final.

Don't disturb chetta: Suryakumar Yadav pokes fun at Sanju Samson on Trivandrum returnIND vs NZ: Suryakumar Yadav poked fun at Sanju Samson as the Indian team arrived in Thiruvananthapuram ahead of the final game of the T20I series against New Zealand.

T20 World Cup will get the best out of Maxwell: Ricky PontingRicky Ponting believes Glenn Maxwell can rediscover his form at the T20 World Cup 2026.  Maxwell scored just 76 runs from eight innings in the Big Bash League 2025–26.

Captain Siraj claims four as Hyderabad dominate Chhattisgarh in Ranji TrophyMohammed Siraj led from the front as Hyderabad captain with his four-wicket haul leading the way for Chhattisgarh to be bundled out on the opening day's play.

Saim Ayub shines as Pakistan finally beat Australia in a T20I after 2650 daysPakistan vs Australia, 1st T20I: An all-round performance from Saim Ayub helped Pakistan end a 2,650-day wait for a T20I win over Australia, sealing a 22-run victory at Lahore's Gaddafi Stadium.

Michael Nobbs, Australian hockey great and former India coach, dies after illnessFormer Australian hockey player Michael Nobbs, who coached the Indian men's team at the 2012 London Olympics, has died after a prolonged illness.

Track and field stars found guilty of betting on teammates at major tournamentsGerman discus throwers Henrik Janssen and Steven Richter received three-month suspended bans, while French runner Aurore Fleury faces a six-month ban and a 3,000 Euros fine after admitting to betting on athletics events, in violation of World Athletics Integrity Code rules.

19-year-old Indian grandmaster, Divya Deshmukh set to make her debut in Norway ChessIndian Grandmaster Divya Deshmukh will make her maiden appearance at Norway Chess Women, becoming the youngest competitor in the tournament's recent history and joining a field that includes reigning champions and world-class rivals.

Air pollution forces Mumbai players to wear face masks in Ranji clash vs DelhiMumbai's players were forced to wear face masks on Thursday to protect themselves from pollution caused by nearby construction on the opening day of their Ranji Trophy match against Delhi.

T20 World Cup 2026 Venue: Wankhede Stadium, MumbaiT20 World Cup 2026 Venue: The Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai is one of the most loved venues in Indian cricket. The Wankhede promises electrifying action every time players take the field. Wankhede can host up to 33,500 people.

T20 World Cup 2026 Venue: Arun Jaitley Stadium, DelhiT20 World Cup 2026 Venue: Built in the centre of New Delhi, the Arun Jaitley Stadium has always been a mixed bag in terms of facilities and aesthetics. However, no one can deny that the 55,000-strong crowd has made the games incredibly memorable in recent years.

T20 World Cup 2026 Venue: Narendra Modi Stadium, AhmedabadT20 World Cup 2026 Venue: The Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad is the world's largest cricket stadium. With a capacity of over one lakh spectators, it has consistently hosted marquee events in the cricketing world.

T20 World Cup 2026 Venue: Eden Gardens, KolkataT20 World Cup 2026 Venue: The iconic Eden Gardens stadium in Kolkata, will host a total of 6 matches in the tournament. The stadium at the moment can host up to 68,000 people, but there are plans to expand its capacity to 1,00,000.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
